job_tasks.phrase: IBM Data & AI DevOps team is responsible for creating automated processes to develop, test, deploy, and maintain software systems across the whole software development lifecycle.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly describes the core responsibilities of a DevOps engineer, focusing on the automation of the software development lifecycle, including development, testing, deployment, and maintenance, which aligns with the definition of Operations & MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: continuous integration and continuous deployment is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the importance of CI/CD practices, a key component of DevOps and MLOps, aligning with the category's focus on deployment and maintenance pipelines.

job_tasks.phrase: As a DevOps engineer you will be responsible for design, development, maintenance and support of the IBM Knowledge Catalog services through the full systems development lifecycle on both SaaS and Hybrid Cloud platforms .
job_tasks.justification: This sentence reiterates the responsibility for the entire systems development lifecycle, including maintenance and support, which falls under the Operations & MLOps umbrella.

job_tasks.phrase: adhering to industry best practices for quality, performance, scalability, resiliency and security.
job_tasks.justification: These are all key operational concerns in software development and deployment, directly related to ensuring the reliability and robustness of systems, fitting the Operations & MLOps category.

job_tasks.phrase: You will work in a Kubernetes based micro services environment to support our bleeding edge cloud services.
job_tasks.justification: Working with Kubernetes and microservices for cloud services is a core aspect of modern DevOps and MLOps, focusing on the infrastructure and deployment environment.

job_tasks.phrase: This will include custom solutions, as well as open source DevOps tools (build and deploy automation, monitoring and data gathering for our software delivery pipeline).
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions build and deploy automation, monitoring, and data gathering for the software delivery pipeline, which are all central to the Operations & MLOps category.

job_tasks.phrase: You will also be contributing to our continuous improvement and continuous delivery while increasing maturity of DevOps and agile adoption practices.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly addresses continuous improvement, continuous delivery, and the maturity of DevOps practices, aligning perfectly with the Operations & MLOps category.

soft_skills.phrase: You are curious to learn as demonstrated by your up-to-date technical knowledge and demonstrated ongoing learning.
You are a good team player
working knowledge of Agile methodologies and principles.
We seek an applicant who will thrive in an open, dynamic, flexible, fun, spirited, collaborative environment
an individual who desires creative freedom
opportunity to work in a high performing team.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses exclusively on DevOps responsibilities, including CI/CD, automation, deployment, maintenance, and working with infrastructure like Kubernetes and microservices. There are no tasks mentioned that involve the development, fine-tuning, or application of AI/ML models themselves. Therefore, the role is classified as a Software Engineer, specifically within the DevOps domain.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the responsibilities of a DevOps engineer. It explicitly details tasks related to automation, deployment, and infrastructure management, and does not mention any AI/ML model development or integration tasks. This makes the classification straightforward.
